column1: Yakima ( or ) is a  city in and the county seat of Yakima County
column3: and the state's eleventh-largest city by population. As of the 2010 census
column4: the city had a total population of 91
column6: 231. The unincorporated suburban areas of West Valley and Terrace Heights are considered a part of greater Yakima.Yakima is about 60 miles (100 kilometers) southeast of Mount Rainier in Washington. It is situated in the Yakima Valley
column7: a productive agricultural region noted for apple
column10: the Yakima Valley produces 77% of all hops grown in the United States. The name Yakima originates from the Yakama Nation Native American tribe

column1: The Yakama people were the first known inhabitants of the Yakima Valley. In 1805
column2: the Lewis and Clark Expedition came to the area and discovered abundant wildlife and rich soil
column3: prompting the settlement of homesteaders. A Catholic Mission was established in Ahtanum
column4: southwest of present-day Yakima
column5: in 1847. The arrival of settlers and their conflicts with the natives resulted in the Yakima War. The U.S. Army established Fort Simcoe in 1856 near present-day White Swan as a response to the uprising. The Yakamas were defeated and forced to relocate to the Yakama Indian Reservation.Yakima County was created in 1865. When bypassed by the Northern Pacific Railroad in December 1884
column6: over 100 buildings were moved with rollers and horse teams to the nearby site of the depot. The new city was dubbed North Yakima and was officially incorporated and named the county seat on January 27
column7: 1886. The name was changed to Yakima in 1918. Union Gap was the new name given to the original site of Yakima.On May 18
column9: the eruption of Mount St. Helens caused a large amount of volcanic ash to fall on the Yakima area. Visibility was reduced to near-zero conditions that afternoon
column10: and the ash overloaded the city's wastewater treatment plant.

column1: The city of Yakima is located in the Upper Valley of Yakima County. The county is geographically divided by Ahtanum Ridge and Rattlesnake Ridge into two regions: the Upper (northern) and Lower (southern) valleys. Yakima is located in the more urbanized Upper Valley
column2: and is the central city of the Yakima Metropolitan Statistical Area.

column1: Yakima has a semi-arid climate (Köppen BSk) with a Mediterranean precipitation pattern. Winters are cold
column3: with a mean temperature of 28.5 °F (−1.9 °C). Annual average snowfall is 21.6 inches (55 cm)
column4: with most occurring in December and January
column5: when the snow depth averages 2 to 3 in (5.1 to 7.6 cm). There are 22 days per year in which the high does not surpass freezing
column6: and 2.3 mornings where the low is 0 °F (−18 °C) or lower. Springtime warming is very gradual
column7: with the average last freeze of the season May 13. Summer days are hot
column8: but the diurnal temperature variation is large
column10: sometimes reaching as high as 50 °F (27.8 °C) during that season; there are 34 afternoons of maxima reaching 90 °F (32 °C) or greater annually and 3.2 afternoons of 100 °F (38 °C) maxima. Autumn cooling is very rapid
column11: with the average first freeze of the season occurring on September 30. Due to the city's location in a rain shadow
column13: at an average of 8.25 inches (210 mm) annually
column15: but especially during summer. Extreme temperatures have ranged from −25 °F (−32 °C) on February 1

column1: Cultural activities and events take place throughout the year. The Yakima Valley Museum houses exhibits related to the region's natural and cultural history
column3: and periodic special exhibitions. Downtown Yakima's historic Capitol Theatre and Seasons Performance Hall

column5: present numerous musical and stage productions. Larson Gallery housed at Yakima Valley College present six diverse art exhibitions each year. The city is home to the Yakima Symphony Orchestra. The Yakima Area Arboretum is a botanical garden featuring species of both native and adapted non-native plants. Popular music tours
column7: and other large events are hosted at the Yakima SunDome in State Fair Park.
